description: From Latin vociferatus, past participle of vociferari (“to vociferate”), from vox, vocis (“voice”) + ferre (“to bear”). See voice, and bear (“to carry”).

verbs.description: vociferate (third-person singular simple present vociferates, present participle vociferating, simple past and past participle vociferated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To utter with a loud voice; to shout out.
examples: Though he may vociferate the word liberty.
